result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Egana was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Carrying License. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 07/01/2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 2 year suspension of driver's license for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Affidavit for Services Rendered filed by Atty Graber.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Kenneth Egana in court with attorney Katherine Jean Graber.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State moves to amend the charge a forfeiture of operate without carrying a license 343.18(1).  The Court amends the charge, enter a no contest plea and finds the Defendant guilty.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
FINE: $330.50.  Defendant to pay $50.00 per month commencing 7/1/16 or Drivers license suspension imposed for 2 years or until paid in full as failure to pay.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Egana in court with attorney Katherine Jean Graber.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Graber requests additional time for her Defendant to obtain a valid license in case 16TR506.  The Court grants the request and reschedules the matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kenneth Egana in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant has not retained counsel at this point.  The Defendant to apply at the public defender's office and return back to court after evaluated.  The case is recalled and the Defendant does not qualify for representation by the public defender's office.  The Defendant is sworn in and examined by the Court.  The Court finds the Defendant is eligible for representation at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 4/1/16.  The Court sets the matter for a hearing in about 30 days.
Hearing at 02-17-2016 09:00 am
